output.conclusion: This course provides a foundational understanding of telecommunication switching principles, preparing you for more advanced topics in telecommunications.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Telecommunication Switching course! This course introduces the fundamental concepts of telecommunication switching systems. We'll explore different switching techniques and their applications in modern communication networks.

chapters.description: Overview of telecommunication networks and the role of switching. Basic definitions: switching node, link, circuit, packet. Historical perspective of switching systems.
Circuit switching vs. packet switching. Comparison of advantages and disadvantages. Applications of each type of switching.
Call establishment, call maintenance, and call termination. Signaling protocols overview. Addressing and routing concepts.
Principle of space division switching. Crossbar switches and their limitations. Blocking probability in space division switches.
Principle of time division switching. Time slot interchange (TSI). Time multiplexed switching (TMS).
Combining space and time division switching. Multistage switches. Advantages and disadvantages of multistage switches.
Definition of signaling. In-band vs. out-of-band signaling. Common signaling protocols: SS7, SIP.
Overview of SS7 architecture. Message Transfer Part (MTP). Signaling Connection Control Part (SCCP).
Overview of SIP protocol. SIP messages: INVITE, ACK, BYE. SIP architecture and components.
Hierarchical structure of the telephone network. Local exchange, tandem exchange, toll exchange. Numbering plan.
Call routing in the PSTN. Trunk groups and their role. Call setup and teardown process.
Introduction to VoIP and its impact on the PSTN. Migration from circuit switching to packet switching.
Principles of packet switching. Packet formats and headers. Routing algorithms in packet switched networks.
IP addressing and routing. Routers and their functions. Quality of Service (QoS) in IP networks.
Introduction to MPLS. Label switching. MPLS architecture and benefits.
